solution_line_template: If Kimiko is {kimiko_age}, Omi is {omi_multiplier} * {kimiko_age} years = <<{kimiko_age}*{omi_multiplier}={omi_age}>>{omi_age} years old.
If you add up their ages, it sums to {arlette_age} years + {omi_age} years + {kimiko_age} years = <<{arlette_age}+{omi_age}+{kimiko_age}={total_age}>>{total_age} years
The average age for the three is {total_age} years / {number_of_people} people = <<{total_age}/{number_of_people}={average_age}>>{average_age} years/person
